result.execSummary:
The defendant Kathryn M Omelia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges and Court Costs.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
Fine is to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Restitution of $689.20 to Chase and $1,632.90 to Jay S. - to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
DNA surcharge to be paid a Condition of Probation.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Not be responsible for handling any money in any business.
Take Financial courses.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - (nonworking hours) Huber-w/standard release conditions.
Last 20 days STAYED and to be used at Agent's discretion as well as to the Huber/straight time.

To perform 100 hours at a rate of $10.00/hr to offset the fines/costs.
Court will allow up to 150 hours community service.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kathryn M Omelia

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 100 hours to offset fine/costs.

Signed by Judge Aprahamian on 5/5/15.  The defendant is granted a four hour pass to permit visitation at the time of the birth of her grandchild.  The defendant is to provide verification to the Huber Facility.
Dated May 1, 2015 filed by the Defendant requesting to be released to attend the birth of her grandchild.

Defendant Kathryn M Omelia in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  Kevin M. Osborne and Barbara Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1. 


Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 4 years (Initial Confinement: 2 years, Extended Supervision: 2 years)  Stayed for 3 years Probation
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Fine totaling $918.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Restitution of $689.20 to be paid to Chase and $1632.90 to be paid to Jay S. as a Condition of Probation.
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation:   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. Not be responsible for handling any money in any business. Take financial courses.   Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
- Defendant to perform 100 hours of community service at a rate of $10.00 per hour to offset the fines and costs. (Court grants that the defendant may perform up to 150 hours of community service). 
 -  9 months jail with huber Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing 04/17/2015 by 6:00 p.m.. Non working hours with standard release conditions. Last 20 days STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/straight time at the agent's discretion.
Character and employment letters filed by Attorney Smith for the Court's review.
Character letter filed by third party. (2 letters filed)
Sentencing hearing on April 15, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
filed by Defense
